info.description:
The Custom Object Data (Multi-Instance) service enables applications to access and manage multi-instance custom objects.

Custom objects are extensions of existing Workday business objects. Example: The Worker object can be extended to include a custom object named Stock Grants.  If a worker can have more than 1 stock grant, the Stock Grants custom object is a multi-instance custom object. To see the custom object definition in Workday, run the View Custom Object task. You can also run the Custom Object Definitions report  to see all custom object definitions for a business object.
info.title: Custom Object Data (Multi-Instance)

tags.name: Custom Objects
tags.description:
Provides the ability to create, update, and delete data for a multi-instance  custom object.
The field types vary based on the custom object definition. To understand the required format of a request body when creating or updating a custom object, first call the GET method on a multi-instance custom object created in Workday.

tags.name: {Business Object}
tags.description: Provides the ability to access the custom object data of an extended business object.

parameters.name: businessObjectResource
parameters.description: The resource name of the Workday business object that has been extended by the multi-instance custom object.

parameters.name: businessObjectId
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the extended business object instance.

parameters.name: customObjectAlias
parameters.description: The web service alias of the custom object. To determine the web service alias of the custom object definition in Workday, run the View Custom Object task.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of multi-instance custom objects.
get.description:
Retrieves a collection containing the multi-instance custom objects for a specific instance of an extended business object. See the available values of the {businessObjectResource} path parameter for the list of supported Workday business objects.

Secured by: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object
Scope: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

schema.description: A collection containing the multi-instance custom objects.

parameters.name: customObjectAlias
parameters.description: The web service alias of the custom object. To determine the web service alias of the custom object definition in Workday, run the View Custom Object task.

post.summary: Creates instances of multi-instance custom objects.
post.description:
In the request body, include the extended Workday object ID that the custom object is attached to. To specify the custom object fields, you can use the response data model from calling GET /customObjects/{customObjectAlias}/{ID} on an existing custom object instance. You can also see the custom object definition in the View Custom Object task.
If the multi-instance custom object definition uses a reference ID, include the reference ID field in the request body.

To create multiple custom object instances, specify the query parameter bulk=true. In the request body, specify an array containing each custom object instance. You can specify custom object instances  for different business object IDs.

To update an existing custom object instance, specify the query parameter updateIfExists=true. In the request body, specify the custom fields to update. 

Secured by: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object
Scope: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object.

parameters.name: updateIfExists
parameters.description: If true, updates the custom object instance if it exists. If false, returns an error if the object exists. The default is false. If the object does not exist, a new object is created regardless of this setting.

parameters.name: bulk
parameters.description: If true, creates or updates the specified array of custom object instances in the request body. If false, specify a single object (without an array). The default is false.

parameters.name: customObjectRequestBody
parameters.description: The custom object instance to be persisted. If bulk=true, specify an array containing the custom object instances, with a maximum of 100. If bulk=false (default), specify a JSON object.

200.description: Custom object collection created or updated.

parameters.name: customObjectAlias
parameters.description: The web service alias of the custom object. To determine the web service alias of the custom object definition in Workday, run the View Custom Object task.

parameters.name: customObjectID
parameters.description:
If the multi-instance custom object definition uses a reference ID, specify a semicolon-delimited concatenation of the business object Workday ID and reference ID using the format {businessObjectWID};{referenceIdAlias}={referenceIdValue}.

If the multi-instance custom object definition doesn't use a reference ID, specify the Workday ID of the custom object instance. 
Use a returned id from GET /{extendedBusinessObjectResource}/{extendedBusinessObjectId}/customObjects/{customObjectAlias}.

get.summary: Get a specific instance of a multi-instance custom object
get.description:
Retrieves an instance of a multi-instance custom object with the specified ID. Specify either the custom object instance ID or a concatenation of the business object ID and reference ID, which uses the format {businessObjectWID};{referenceIdAlias}={referenceIdValue}.

Example: Assume that the Worker ID is 12345 and the custom field alias of the reference ID is grantName, whose value is 4Q2011. To get an instance of Stock Grants for that worker, call GET /customObjects/stockGrants/12345;grantName=4Q2011  

Secured by: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object
Scope: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

put.summary: Updates an instance of a multi-instance custom object.
put.description:
Updates an existing instance of a multi-instance custom object with the specified ID. Specify either the custom object ID or a concatenation of the business object ID and reference ID, which uses the format {businessObjectWID};{referenceIdAlias}={referenceIdValue}.

Example: Assume that the Worker ID is 12345 and the custom field alias of the reference ID is grantName, whose value is 4Q2011. To update an instance of Stock Grants for that worker, call PUT /customObjects/stockGrants/12345;grantName=4Q2011. Include the fields you want to update in the request body. Don't include the business object ID in the request body. 


Secured by: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object
Scope: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object.

parameters.name: customObjectRequestBody
parameters.description: The custom object fields to be updated.

delete.summary: Deletes an instance of a custom object.
delete.description:
Deletes an existing instance of a multi-instance custom object with the specified ID. Specify either the custom object ID or a concatenation of the business object ID and reference ID, which uses the format {businessObjectWID};{referenceIdAlias}={referenceIdValue}.

Secured by: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object
Scope: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object.

customObjectInstance.description: Contains the extended business object instance and custom object fields.

customObjectFields.description: Contains the custom fields of the custom object.

instance.description: The Workday business object instance ID.
